content:
TITLE: Loading .bashrc in .bash_profile Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Snippet to source .bashrc file within .bash_profile to ensure Bash-it loads correctly in both login and interactive shell scenarios. This is a recommended practice for consistent behavior across different terminal environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/installation.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
if [ -f ~/.bashrc ]; then
  . ~/.bashrc
fi
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Load Priority Configuration for Bash-it Components
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting custom load priority for Bash-it components using a special comment directive. This overrides the default load priority order of aliases (150), plugins (250), and completions (350).
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/development.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# BASH_IT_LOAD_PRIORITY: 225
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Saving and Loading Bash-it Profiles
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to save a custom Bash-it profile, load the default profile, make configuration changes, and reload a saved profile. It showcases the basic usage of the 'bash-it profile' command for managing Bash-it configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/profile.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Saves your current profile
bash-it profile save my_profile
# Load the default profile, which is the one used in the default installation.
bash-it profile load default

# Do whatever you want:
# Disable stuff
bash-it disable ...
# Enable stuff
bash-it enable ...
# If you want to get back into your original configuration, you can do it easily
bash-it profile load my_profile
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Latest Bash on x86 Mac
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install and configure the latest version of Bash on x86 Mac systems using Homebrew. This includes installing Bash, adding it to the allowed shells list, and setting it as the default shell.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/troubleshooting.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
brew install bash
sudo sh -c 'echo /usr/local/bin/bash >> /etc/shells'
chsh -s /usr/local/bin/bash
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Bash-it Component Information and Help
DESCRIPTION: Commands for displaying information about Bash-it's components (aliases, completions, plugins) and accessing their help documentation. Shows both installed and available components, and provides detailed help for installed components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/help_screens.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it show aliases        # shows installed and available aliases
bash-it show completions    # shows installed and available completions
bash-it show plugins        # shows installed and available plugins
bash-it help aliases        # shows help for installed aliases
bash-it help completions    # shows help for installed completions
bash-it help plugins        # shows help for installed plugins
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Latest Bash on M1 Mac
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install and configure the latest version of Bash on M1 Mac systems using Homebrew. This accounts for the different installation path on M1 Macs (/opt/homebrew/bin/).
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/troubleshooting.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
brew install bash
sudo sh -c 'echo /opt/homebrew/bin/bash >> /etc/shells'
chsh -s /opt/homebrew/bin/bash
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Bash-it Search Syntax
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic syntax for using the Bash-it search command to find modules related to specific terms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/search.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it search term1 [[-]term2] [[-]term3]....
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Bash-it Theme in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Examples of how to set the BASH_IT_THEME variable to use different themes or disable theming in Bash-it. This includes using built-in themes, custom themes, or disabling themes altogether.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Use the "powerline-multiline" theme
export BASH_IT_THEME="powerline-multiline"

# Use a theme outside of the Bash-it folder
export BASH_IT_THEME="/home/foo/my_theme/my_theme.theme.bash"

# Disable theming
export BASH_IT_THEME=""
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Bash-it to Stable Version
DESCRIPTION: Command to update Bash-it to the latest stable version. This ensures you have the most recent stable features and bug fixes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/update.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it update stable
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Custom Bash-it Directory Path
DESCRIPTION: Sets the BASH_IT_CUSTOM environment variable in ~/.bashrc to specify an alternative location for custom Bash-it scripts that will be kept under version control.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/custom.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
BASH_IT_CUSTOM
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Basic Bash-it Doctor Command
DESCRIPTION: The basic command to run the Bash-it doctor which reloads your bash profile and prints logs to help troubleshoot Bash-it issues. By default, this will print all logs including debug logs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/doctor.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it doctor
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Bash-it Uninstall Script
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to navigate to the Bash-it directory and execute the uninstall script, which will restore your previous Bash profile configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/uninstalling.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd $BASH_IT
./uninstall.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Migrating Bash-it to Latest Structure
DESCRIPTION: Command to migrate from an older version of Bash-it to ensure compatibility with structural changes. This command runs automatically with update, enable, or disable commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/update.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it migrate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Bash-it reload command
DESCRIPTION: The reload alias allows convenient reloading of your Bash profile after making changes. This command should not be used when changing themes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/reload.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
reload
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Bash-it Proxy Plugin
DESCRIPTION: Command to enable the proxy plugin in Bash-it framework. This is the first step required to use proxy management functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/proxy_support.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it enable plugin proxy
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting automatic reload after configuration changes
DESCRIPTION: Environment variable that enables automatic reload of Bash-it after activating or deactivating plugins, aliases, or completions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/reload.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export BASH_IT_AUTOMATIC_RELOAD_AFTER_CONFIG_CHANGE=1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Bash-it Test Suite
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the test suite using Bats Test Framework to verify Bash-it functionality. This command ensures Bats is available in the test_lib directory and runs all tests in the test folder.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/contributing.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
test/run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Git Status Display Options in Bash Profile
DESCRIPTION: Environment variable settings to control Git status display behavior in Bash-it prompts, including version control checking, detail level, and remote information display.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/vcs_user.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export SCM_CHECK=false
export SCM_CHECK=true
export SCM_GIT_SHOW_DETAILS=true
export SCM_GIT_SHOW_DETAILS=false
export SCM_GIT_SHOW_REMOTE_INFO=auto
export SCM_GIT_SHOW_REMOTE_INFO=true
export SCM_GIT_SHOW_REMOTE_INFO=false
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Silent Update of Bash-it
DESCRIPTION: Command to update Bash-it automatically without user interaction using the silent flag. This is useful for scripted or unattended updates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/update.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it update dev --silent
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Bash-Preexec in Bash Profile
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to download the bash-preexec script and add it to the bash profile for persistent use across sessions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Pull down our file from GitHub and write it to our home directory as a hidden file.
curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec/master/bash-preexec.sh -o ~/.bash-preexec.sh
# Source our file at the end of our bash profile (e.g. ~/.bashrc, ~/.profile, or ~/.bash_profile)
echo '[[ -f ~/.bash-preexec.sh ]] && source ~/.bash-preexec.sh' >> ~/.bashrc
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Bash-it with Custom Configuration File Location
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to install Bash-it while specifying a custom location for the configuration file instead of using the default ~/.bashrc path.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
BASH_IT_CONFIG_FILE=path/to/my/custom/location.bash ~/.bash_it/install.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Powerline Padding for macOS High Sierra
DESCRIPTION: Sets the padding value for the Powerline theme to ensure proper segment alignment on macOS High Sierra. The padding needs to be set to 3 before Bash-it is loaded in either ~/.bash_profile or ~/.bashrc file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/powerline-multiline.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export POWERLINE_PADDING=3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Bash-it to Development Version
DESCRIPTION: Command to update Bash-it to the latest development version directly from the master branch. This provides access to the newest features that haven't been released to stable yet.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/update.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it update dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Automatically Setting Atomic Theme on macOS
DESCRIPTION: This command uses sed to automatically replace the current Bash-it theme with the Atomic theme in the ~/.bash_profile file for macOS systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/atomic.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Set the "atomic" theme replacing the theme you are using of bash-it
sed -i '' 's/'"$BASH_IT_THEME"'/atomic/g' ~/.bash_profile
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Bash-it Doctor with Specified Verbosity
DESCRIPTION: This command allows you to specify the level of verbosity for the Bash-it doctor output. You can filter to show only errors, only warnings, or all log messages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/doctor.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it doctor [errors/warnings/all]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching with Negations in Bash-it
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to exclude specific terms from the search results by prefixing them with a hyphen.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/search.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
‚ùØ bash-it search ruby rake gem bundle irb rails -chruby
         aliases:  bundler rails
         plugins:  ruby
     completions:  bundler gem rake
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching for Ruby-related Modules in Bash-it
DESCRIPTION: Example of searching for modules related to Ruby development in Bash-it, including terms like ruby, rake, gem, bundle, and rails.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/search.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
‚ùØ bash-it search ruby rake gem bundle irb rails
         aliases:  bundler rails
         plugins:  chruby chruby-auto ruby
     completions:  bundler gem rake
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling ASCII Color in Bash-it Search Output
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to remove non-printing ASCII characters responsible for coloring the search output by setting the NO_COLOR environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/search.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
‚ùØ NO_COLOR=1 bash-it search ruby rake gem bundle irb rails -chruby
         aliases  =>   ‚úìbundler ‚úìrails
         plugins  =>   ‚úìruby
     completions  =>   bundler gem rake
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Bash-it restart command
DESCRIPTION: The restart command provides a stronger refresh than reload by re-executing Bash completely. This is similar to closing and reopening your terminal.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/commands/reload.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bash-it restart
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Composure in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Commands to download and install the Composure framework in a Bash environment. This sequence downloads the script, makes it executable, and adds it to the user's bash configuration file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd /your/favorite/directory
curl -L http://git.io/composure > composure.sh
chmod +x composure.sh
echo "source $(pwd)/composure.sh" >> ~/.bashrc   # or, ~/.bash_profile on osx
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Vendor Library Status Check Command
DESCRIPTION: Command and sample output for checking the status of vendored libraries using git vendor list.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/development.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
[feature/branch] $ git vendor list
preexec@0.4.1:
    name:   preexec
    dir:    vendor/github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec
    repo:   https://github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec
    ref:    0.4.1
    commit: 8fe585c5cf377a3830b895fe26e694b020d8db1a
[feature/branch] $
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Git Commit Count and User Display
DESCRIPTION: Settings for controlling the display of commit count differences and current Git user information in the prompt
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/vcs_user.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export SCM_GIT_SHOW_COMMIT_COUNT=true
export SCM_GIT_SHOW_COMMIT_COUNT=false
export SCM_THEME_CURRENT_USER_PREFFIX=' ‚ò∫Ô∏é '
export SCM_THEME_CURRENT_USER_SUFFIX=' ‚ò∫Ô∏é '
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Command Duration Display in Bash-it
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to enable the command duration feature in Bash-it themes and customize the minimum duration threshold. This feature displays the execution time of the last command if it exceeds a specified duration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export BASH_IT_COMMAND_DURATION=true

export COMMAND_DURATION_MIN_SECONDS=5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Git Minimal Info Display
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for enabling minimal Git status information display to improve prompt performance
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/vcs_user.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export SCM_GIT_SHOW_MINIMAL_INFO=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Function Metadata
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the 'metafor' function to extract metadata from a shell function definition based on a specified keyword.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
typeset -f foo | metafor about  # displays:
perform mad script-foo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SSH Prompt Display in BarbUk Theme
DESCRIPTION: Configuration options for the SSH prompt in the BarbUk theme. This allows customization of hostname format and whether to display SSH information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/themes/barbuk/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# short or long
export BARBUK_HOST_INFO=short
# true or false
export BARBUK_SSH_INFO=false
source "$BASH_IT"/bash_it.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Metadata to Shell Functions
DESCRIPTION: Example of using Composure's metadata system to add documentation to shell functions with custom keywords defined by the 'cite' function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
foo()
{
    cite about
    about perform mad script-foo
    echo 'foo'
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Brainy Prompt Segment Order
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables that control the order and placement of prompt segments in the terminal display.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/brainy.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
___BRAINY_TOP_LEFT="user_info dir scm"
___BRAINY_TOP_RIGHT="python ruby todo clock battery"
___BRAINY_BOTTOM="exitcode char"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Quick Start: Installing and Using Bash-Preexec in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to download the bash-preexec script, source it, and define basic preexec and precmd functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Pull down our file from GitHub and write it to our home directory as a hidden file.
curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec/master/bash-preexec.sh -o ~/.bash-preexec.sh
# Source our file to bring it into our environment
source ~/.bash-preexec.sh
# Define a couple functions.
preexec() { echo "just typed $1"; }
precmd() { echo "printing the prompt"; }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Powerline Prompt User Info Mode in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Configures the Powerline theme to display user information. When set to 'sudo', it hides the username and hostname, showing only an indicator when sudo credentials are cached.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/powerline-base.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export POWERLINE_PROMPT_USER_INFO_MODE="sudo"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Powerline Prompt Segment Order
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the order of information segments displayed in the Powerline prompt. This example shows the default configuration with user info, SCM status, Python environment, Ruby environment, and current directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/powerline-base.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
POWERLINE_PROMPT="user_info scm python_venv ruby cwd"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Clock Format in Powerline Theme
DESCRIPTION: Sets the format for displaying time in the Powerline theme. The format uses the date command syntax and can be customized to show hours, minutes, seconds, and other time elements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/powerline-base.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export THEME_CLOCK_FORMAT="%H:%M:%S"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Atomic Theme in Bash Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to set the Atomic theme as the active theme for Bash-it by modifying the BASH_IT_THEME environment variable in the ~/.bashrc file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/atomic.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Use the "atomic" theme
export BASH_IT_THEME="atomic"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Randomizing Colors for Nwinkler Theme in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This command forces the selection of new random colors for the Nwinkler Random Color Theme. It overwrites the previously saved color configuration in the ~/.nwinkler_random_colors file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/nwinkler_random_colors.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
randomize_nwinkler
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Default BarbUk Theme Glyphs Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Default glyph definitions for various theme components including git hosting services, SCM tools, and environment indicators. These glyphs require a Nerd Font to display properly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/barbuk.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
BARBUK_GITLAB_CHAR='  '
BARBUK_BITBUCKET_CHAR='  '
BARBUK_GITHUB_CHAR='  '
BARBUK_GIT_DEFAULT_CHAR='  '
BARBUK_GIT_BRANCH_ICON=''
BARBUK_CURRENT_USER_PREFFIX='  '
BARBUK_HG_CHAR='‚òø '
BARBUK_SVN_CHAR='‚ëÜ '
BARBUK_EXIT_CODE_ICON=' '
BARBUK_PYTHON_VENV_CHAR=' '
BARBUK_COMMAND_DURATION_ICON='  '
BARBUK_RUBY_CHAR=' '
BARBUK_NODE_CHAR=' '
BARBUK_TERRAFORM_CHAR="‚ù≤t‚ù≥ "
BARBUK_AWS_PROFILE_CHAR=" aws "
BARBUK_SCALEWAY_PROFILE_CHAR=" scw "
BARBUK_GCLOUD_CHAR=" gcp "
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Distro Logo in Redline Theme
DESCRIPTION: Configuration setting to enable the distribution logo display in the Redline theme prompt.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/redline.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export POWERLINE_PROMPT_DISTRO_LOGO="yes"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Theme Environment Variables in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Default environment variable settings for configuring various aspects of the Brainy theme, including display preferences and formatting options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/brainy.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
THEME_SHOW_SUDO=true
THEME_SHOW_SCM=true
THEME_SHOW_RUBY=false
THEME_SHOW_PYTHON=false
THEME_SHOW_TODO=false
THEME_SHOW_CLOCK=true
THEME_CLOCK_COLOR=$bold_cyan
THEME_CLOCK_FORMAT="%H:%M:%S"
THEME_SHOW_BATTERY=false
THEME_SHOW_EXITCODE=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Functions to Preexec and Precmd Arrays in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to define functions and add them to the preexec_functions and precmd_functions arrays for multiple hook executions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Define some function to use preexec
preexec_hello_world() { echo "You just entered $1"; }
# Add it to the array of functions to be invoked each time.
preexec_functions+=(preexec_hello_world)

precmd_hello_world() { echo "This is invoked before the prompt is displayed"; }
precmd_functions+=(precmd_hello_world)

precmd_hello_one() { echo "This is invoked on precmd first"; }
precmd_hello_two() { echo "This is invoked on precmd second"; }
precmd_functions+=(precmd_hello_one)
precmd_functions+=(precmd_hello_two)

echo ${preexec_functions[@]}
echo ${precmd_functions[@]}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Customizing BarbUk Theme Glyphs
DESCRIPTION: Example of how to customize theme glyphs by setting environment variables before sourcing bash-it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/barbuk.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export BARBUK_GITHUB_CHAR='‚Ä¢'
source "$BASH_IT"/bash_it.sh
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Subshell Support for Bash-Preexec
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to enable experimental subshell support for bash-preexec by setting an environment variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Enable experimental subshell support
export __bp_enable_subshells="true"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Basic Redline Theme Settings in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Core configuration settings for the Redline theme including theme selection, SCM checking, hostname settings, and prompt customization. These settings control the basic behavior and appearance of the Redline theme.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/redline.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
## set the theme
export BASH_IT_THEME='redline'

# Set this to false to turn off version control status checking within the prompt for all themes
export SCM_CHECK=true

## Set Xterm/screen/Tmux title with only a short hostname.
export SHORT_HOSTNAME=$(hostname -s)

## enable sudo prompt
export POWERLINE_PROMPT_USER_INFO_MODE="sudo"

## prompt part string
export POWERLINE_PROMPT="python_venv user_info hostname cwd scm"
```

----------------------------------------

BARBUK_PYTHON_VENV_CHAR=' '
BARBUK_COMMAND_DURATION_ICON='  '
BARBUK_RUBY_CHAR=' '
BARBUK_NODE_CHAR=' '
BARBUK_TERRAFORM_CHAR="‚ù≤t‚ù≥ "
BARBUK_AWS_PROFILE_CHAR=" aws "

BARBUK_GCLOUD_CHAR=" gcp "

TITLE: Automatically Setting Atomic Theme on Linux and Windows
DESCRIPTION: This command uses sed to automatically replace the current Bash-it theme with the Atomic theme in the ~/.bashrc file for Linux and Windows systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/atomic.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Set the "atomic" theme replacing the theme you are using of bash-it
sed -i 's/'"$BASH_IT_THEME"'/atomic/g' ~/.bashrc
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Pattern for Double Bracket Test Conditions in Bash-it
DESCRIPTION: This pattern should be used when features unique to double brackets are needed, such as pattern matching or regular expressions. The `|| return 1` ensures proper behavior in Bats tests across all Bash versions, particularly on macOS which uses Bash 3.2.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec/test/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
[[ ... ]] || return 1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Sudo Environment for SSH
DESCRIPTION: Sudoers configuration to maintain theme functionality when using sudo in SSH sessions by preserving necessary environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/themes-list/barbuk.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat << EOF > /etc/sudoers.d/keepenv
Defaults env_keep += HOME
Defaults env_keep += SSH_CONNECTION
EOF
chmod 400 /etc/sudoers.d/keepenv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Command-Line Crafting Example
DESCRIPTION: Example of iteratively building a complex command by trying different pipe filters, demonstrating the workflow Composure aims to improve.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ cat servers.txt
bashful: up
doc: down

up-arrow

$ cat servers.txt | grep down
doc: down

up-arrow

$ cat servers.txt | grep down | mail -s "down server(s)" admin@here.com
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Preexec and Precmd Functions in Bash
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define and use preexec and precmd functions after sourcing bash-preexec.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
source ~/.bash-preexec.sh
preexec() { echo "just typed $1"; }
precmd() { echo "printing the prompt"; }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Draft Function in Composure
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the 'draft' function to save a command as a reusable shell function, showing how to convert a pipeline into a named function that can be reused.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ cat servers.txt
bashful: up
doc: down

up-arrow

$ cat servers.txt | grep down
doc: down

$ draft finddown

$ finddown | mail -s "down server(s)" admin@here.com
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Automatic Function Loading
DESCRIPTION: Configuration to disable Composure's default behavior of automatically loading all composed functions at startup, useful for environments with many functions or performance concerns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
export LOAD_COMPOSED_FUNCTIONS=0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Revising Shell Functions with Composure
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the 'revise' command to edit a shell function, adding parameters and metadata to improve documentation and functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ revise finddown
finddown ()
{
    about finds servers marked 'down' in text file
    group admin
    cat $1 | grep down
}

$ finddown servers.txt
doc: down
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrading Composure from Pre-1.1.0 Version
DESCRIPTION: Commands for users upgrading from a version prior to 1.1.0 to move the composure repository to its new location under ~/.local/composure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir ~/.local 2>/dev/null
mv ~/.composure ~/.local/composure
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Composure's Help System
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using the 'glossary' and 'reference' commands to display help information for functions based on their metadata.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/vendor/github.com/erichs/composure/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ glossary   # displays:
cite                creates a new meta keyword for use in your functions
draft               wraps last command into a new function
finddown            finds servers marked 'down' in text file
foo                 perform mad script-foo
glossary            displays help summary for all functions, or summary for a group of functions
metafor             prints function metadata associated with keyword
reference           displays apidoc help for a specific function
revise              loads function into editor for revision
write               writes one or more composed function definitions to stdout

meanwhile

$ glossary admin   # displays:
finddown            finds servers marked 'down' in text file

and

$ reference draft  # displays:
draft               wraps last command into a new function
parameters:
                    1: name to give function
examples:
                    $ ls
                    $ draft list
                    $ list
```

* More informative git prompt (if you want to keep it minimal, please read: :ref:`git_prompt`)

* No ruby version prompt

TITLE: Vendored Library Rebase Commands
DESCRIPTION: Command sequence for rebasing a feature branch with a vendored library using git vendor and subtree strategy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/docs/development.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
[feature/branch] $ git rebase --rebase-merges --strategy subtree master
fatal: refusing to merge unrelated histories
Could not apply 0d6a56b... Add-preexec-from-https-github-com-rcaloras-bash-preexec-0-4-1- # Add "preexec" from "https://github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec@0.4.1"
[feature/branch] $ git vendor add preexec https://github.com/rcaloras/bash-preexec 0.4.1
...
[feature/branch] $ git rebase --continue
```

TITLE: Configuring Sudo to Preserve Theme in SSH Sessions
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for sudo to keep HOME and SSH_CONNECTION environment variables, allowing the theme to persist when using sudo -s in an SSH session.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bash-it/bash-it/blob/master/themes/barbuk/README.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cat << EOF > /etc/sudoers.d/keepenv
Defaults env_keep += HOME
Defaults env_keep += SSH_CONNECTION
EOF
chmod 400 /etc/sudoers.d/keepenv
```
